reviews.review: Absolutely fantastic carvings. The Bahia place has fantastic carvings and they made use of symmetry of different shapes everywhere.

1st day in Marrakech, great introduction, beautiful and calm. Spent 2 hours here floating and wandering in shade and sunshine in equal measure. Stunning floor and wall tiles and stucco, with loads of rooms to wander and get lost in, courtyards with banana trees. No English guide material on display, all in French which was a shame, but could possible have taken a guided tour. Refreshing lack of shopping opportunities (which are overwhelming elsewhere!), and a beautiful tranquil little haven from the bustle - highly recommended.

A PLEASANT SURPRISE FOR $1 OR 10 MORROCCAN DIRHAMS. My riad manager told me to skip the Bahia Palace and go the the Badi Palace. Well the Badi Palace was closed for 3 months (as of September 2016) for work. So I walked over to the Bahia palace and was pleasantly surprised by the wonderful architecture, courtyard, sumptuous rooms, the tile work, extravagance. Infinitely interesting, and all for $1 US dollar. I don't know how they maintain the place by charging so little. It's may be a 5-minute walk from the Badi palace. Hugely recommend everyone make a stop at the Bahia Palace.

Beautiful architecture and a taste of history. Don't forget to look up as you tour this Palace the ceilings are breath taking! The palace is void of any furniture so you need to imaging the quarter as you pass through the building. But it does not take much of an imagination to see the beauty this place was in it's time.
Beautiful Architecture . No need to dawdle, but incredible plasterwork and ceilings as you wander around working out how the Vizier had time to handle 4 wives and a massive courtyard of concubines!

first class architecture and history. former palace with beautiful Arabic mosaics, painting, woodwork, colours, flowers in altogether interesting neighbourhood. Worth a visit if you like this kind of attraction.
Beautiful Architecture. Great way to take a breather from the hectic streets. Stunning building with amazing detail, nice gardens, inspiring water features. D10 entrance. Worth it.

Beat the queues!. Another of Marrakech's examples of beautiful architecture and a photographers paradise. I urge to visit as early as possible to beat the crowds and the heat and get the best photos! We didn't get a guide as we were interested in photographing but it may be advised if you are interested in the history.

Breathtaking. On every level this place is fantastic, romantic and serene. One room leads to another each dripping with history and elegance. Oh to live here eh? What must it have been like to dance in the concubine garden and feast with the prime minister and his guests. Truly worth a visit.
Must see. We enjoyed visiting the Bahia Palace.A great introduction into the history and architecture of Marrakech.It is to the West of the city rather than in the city centre.

Unexpectedly amazing. We visited the Bahia Palace as part of a guided tour to the Medina and I must say, it was really surprising. From the outside it does not look much (though our guide told us that Moroccan homes are usually very understated on the outside as a sign of respect to neighbours who may not be as well off) but inside it is really beautiful and worth a visit. I would recommend taking a guide who can explain the history of the different rooms. Overall, a very informative and interesting visit.

Peaceful and beautiful. The Bahia Palace is a wonderful calm oasis to visit on a hot day in Marrakech, with a selection of riads and open places alongside cool rooms full of tiled floors and painted ceilings. A real gem and an escape from the hustle and bustle of the Marrakech streets.

Wow....!!!!. Wow.!!!!!! That was the first impression when I was first step my foot into the palace. The architecture design is somewhat very interesting and vibrant. Bright sunshine as also help to glow the colour of the palace. One of the top place to include in traveler's list.
Quite good. I found the palace beautiful in as much as the tiling the ceilings architecture were 2nd to none..however that was it..just empty rooms ..lovely to sit in the quiet grounds tho
Very well preserved!. A great place to spend the morning. Filled with history and beauty. Make sure you look up...some rooms the ceiling is the highlight.

Beautiful building and. We visited the palace as part of our Discover Marrakech tour (arranged through Thomsons - brilliant day out!). The palace is beautiful, with lovely carvings and very ornate ceilings. As we had our tour guide with us, we were given lots of information about what each of the rooms/areas were used for and the materials used for the structure - this really made the visit great.

STUNNING ARCHITECTURE. This place is fascinating! It gives you a glimpse into the life of the great & good of Marrakech & is a truly beautiful place.Whilst no longer inhabited, you can get some idea of the sort of lifestyle that was enjoyed by the Grand Vizier.There are plenty of stunning architectural features, if that's your thing, or just enjoy the atmosphere of the place.Admission costs about 80p!
Gorgeous Palace - reminiscent of Seville's Alcazar. Breathtaking beauty! Beautiful architecture, intricate carvings and magnificently ornate ceilings! A must see for sure!

Lovely place.. easy to find and unexpected large, beautiful well kept gardens, and good value for money, although it would have nice if more information on the history of the place had been provided, Close to amenities x
Get a guide to tell you the stories. Beautiful building but Very sad recent history for the harem girls abandoned and sold after their use by date. They never had a chance. AmaZing mosaic building

Beautiful architecture . Beautiful architecture and well maintained. Unfortunately every thing is labeled in Arabic or French. Beautiful high ceilings with work, filigree on the windows. A must see. Entrance was approx 20mad.

If you love Moroccan tiles then you must go. We sort of randomly ended up here but very thankful we did, as it's a really beautiful palace. If like me you love Moroccan mosaic tiles then you must go here, it has some amazing designs everywhere you look.

Stunning. The Bahia Palace is stunning, with every wall and ceiling covered in intricate mosaics or carvings. The large courtyard takes your breath away and the garden is a haven of shady greenery. The Saadian Tombs also have amazing mosaics and carvings; the place is smaller but well worth a visit. However, if you can only do one or the other, do the Bahia, and if you can do both, do the Saadian Tombs first.

Nice walk . A large expanse of palace that you can wonder through, taking in the beautiful gardens and fountains. You aren't however allowed to take any pictures and there is plenty of presence from both police and army that surround the gates and palace doors. I nice walk, just to say you've seen it. Wouldn't say it was a must
great to see. a lot of history behind this palace. i just wish our guide spent more time giving us more history the ground was beautiful
Beautiful gardens and Islamic architecture on display. A gorgeous, quiet oasis inside the bustling city. Fantastic place to go if you want to get away from the craziness of the streets.

Glimpses of a bygone age of opulence. A wonderful and interesting palace that is well maintained and a joy to behold. The mosaic work is stunning, the architecture interesting and the gardens relaxing. With or without a tour guide, this is well worth a visit.

Bahia palace Marrakesh , Morocco . The Bahia Palace is a palace and a set of gardens located in Marrakesh, Morocco. It was built in the late 19th century, intended to be the greatest palace of its time. The name means "brilliance". As in other buildings of the period in other countries, it was intended to capture the essence of the Islamic and Moroccan style. There is a 2 acre (8,000 m²) garden with rooms opening onto courtyards.

The Best Palace you can Visit in Marrakech.. Visited this palace recently during my whole stay in Marrakech for years now, this is the right place to visit from the palaces in Marrakech, as you can see there is 2 Bahia and Badi palace, as this one is showing the most amazing life that Ba Hmad and the Vizzir life old time, and you can see the Beautiful gardens it has and the way they preserve this palace should be done with others too.

Beautiful palace and worth the visit. The inside of the Bahia Palace is absolutely stunning!! From the intricate wood and cement carvings throughout the entire palace to the beautiful tile-work everywhere, this place is just beautiful. Several other 'palaces' within Marrakesh but this is the best in my opinion. Also, if you visit Fez during the same trip, do not pay the 20 dirham to go into Bou Inania Palace....huge disappointment after you have seen the beautiful Bahia Palace!

Great for architecture lovers . Beautiful place and worth a visit, especially if you're into architecture! I was there with 35 degree mid-day temperature and there was plenty of shady spots to escape the heat!
Breathtakingly beautiful. This is one of the most beautiful buildings I've ever seen. Absolutely worth the price of admission. Go and explore!
Moroccan architecture at its best. The textbook definition of Moroccan architecture.. Colored tiles, mosaics, colored glass and a lovely small garden in the middle.
Beautiful and serene. Amazing serenity in the middle of all the 'madness'. Beautiful old palace with amazing decor. Very good value at the equivalent of 80p entry fee.

Not boring at all!. I heard a few people saying that Bahia Palace is not worth seeing! It's an architectural building and its absolutely beautiful! Cost about 10 mad. You also have El Badi Palace next by.

Beautiful palace - do not miss. On top 3 attractions in Marrakesh along with Jardin Majorelle and Ben Youssef Madrasa. Beautiful setting if you are interested in taking pictures of mosaic architecture and a spacious garden with a cheap entrance - only 20 Dihrams.

Beautiful and so cheap! . This place is about £1 per person to get in. I wasn't expecting much but it is beautiful. I thought I was only going to be the first courtyard garden but the place just keeps going. The mosaics are beautiful and i enjoyed just wandering through the gardens and building. They are all in different styles and some are just stunning. I completely forgot I was in the middle of the madness that is marrakech. You can get guides but we just took ourselves round as our rough guide had background information. My favourite place in Marrakech by a long way.

Do not miss if you are in Marrakech. This palace in Marrakech is surely worth a visit. It was built in the 19th century for one of his wives by Si Moussa , the grand vizier. It was built by craftsmen from Fez . It is a beautiful structure with ornate cedar wood ceiling and columns. The mosaic work is interesting.
Beatiful Palace. Enjoyed the view, beautiful building and lovely gardens, worth a visit, would suggest you go with a guide so that they explain the building.

Please visit!. From outside it looks Old and unimpressive - but then it is. According to my guide, over 100 years old. Once inside, you know that the builders were very particular with attention to details. The Architecture shows a lot from Spanish/Mediterranean influencesThe Cedar wood ceilings are beautiful and the column capitals are ornately decorated. Only a small portion of the palace is open to the public but was is open is certainly worth a visit and at 10dh, it is a bagain
Boring. Worth a visit to kill time no real historical value as ther is no furniture or artifacts. Glad it was only 10dh. Go visit but don't expect too much

Lovely but.... Stunning looking place, really beautifully decorated and cheap to enter.
However, not a single English translation across the entire complex
Lovely architecture. The mosaics, plaster, and tile work are outstanding. It was interesting to see the harem, public spaces and private.
Historic place. It is a beautiful and historical place. If you love the architecture, you need to visit. THe most beautiful palace of Marrakech.

lovely place !. afternoon, posing for photos in all the great film sets! Good to be able to scramble over the sets without 'Keep Off' signs all over the place :) great few hours entertainment :) and all for 25Dh The history of the film business is very important to the region.

Awesome mosaics. The walk towards the place is nothing compared to what can be viewed inside.
Splendid views of mosaics and superb scenes of the era of the Moors. Especially the contrast between outdoor patio's (banana trees) and indoor mosaics is what makes this place a definate must see in Marrakech.
Nice way to spend an hour out of the madness. A 10 minute walk from the grand square cheap entry 10 MAD and a guide if you need it but we just did our own thing nice mosaics and gardens

Wonderful place to visit, what fantastic value. We paid a visit to this palace as part of a Marrakech day trip.
We spent about two hours with our guide touring this large palace, and found it very entertaining.
We visited during midday, but the site was very airy and cool.
The cost for this wonderful place was 80p!!!!!

Must see on your visit to Marrakech. Bahia Palace is stunning! Excellent price, extremely good value for money. I would recommend going with a guide unless you do some research first as there is little info available as you walk round (Saeed's Marrakech by Locals is a fantastic tour and the price of entry is included in his tour price).

Breathtaking. . WOW. I wish someone would build me a palace.
The Bahia palace is incredible. Such an iconic place. It's cheap to get into. But wow, seriously everywhere you turn is AMAZING.
Moorish architecture. Place is nice with very elaborate patterns. Very Moroccan. Good to go there with a tour guide so you get some history too. Nice photo op place too.

Stunning details! . A great tourist spot to see many Moroccan mosaics and the inner sanctuary gardens. A stunning place everyone has to visit the palace during their stay here. Takes maybe an hour (depending on how many selfies you take)...

Amazing interior art and design. This place is beautiful and well worth the visit. The ceilings, tiles and wall reliefs are really beautiful and rival the work in parts of the Alhambra. Hordes of bus groups can be a bit annoying but they tend to move on quickly.
Big place. Not as inspiring as some other palaces ... large rooms with mosaics ... easy to walk around no hassle from anyone inside ... could do with some seating particularly in the garden

Very pretty and peaceful. Very cheap to get in and worth a visit. It's really pretty, beautiful tiling. There are some info boards but I think only in French and ARabic, though you can enjoy all the design without needing lots of info

Female solo - 26yrs . Defo go with a guide or get a book/guide to know the full story. Beautiful to see. The architecture is amazing. The hammam next door is great too!! beyond luxurious.
From Bahia..... see the Sidi Musée nearby! Similar but more flores and has exhibits.

Beautiful palace and garden. Total bargain! . The palace and gardens are absolutely beautiful there is so much detail everywhere. This is a total must see and at 10dh entry there's no reason not to go. There were a couple of tour groups so it felt quite crowded. There's written information in most areas for details on the history.

Underrated. Very cheap to visit and it took our breath away. It is absolutely glorious to look around.
Beautiful rooms with gorgeous use of colour and tile decorations with stunning gardens.
A definete must-see!
Good for photographers. The mosaics are wonderful but it goes on and on. Hidden garden courtyards are lovely. Also the painted wood shutters.

Stunning. Didn't know what to expect, but it was such a pleasure to find this piece of tranquility amongst the pollution and chaos of the medina, well worth a visit. Their website could do with being updated with opening times and prices, a guide book with details about each room would also be useful to make it a bit more tourist friendly.

Not very impressed. ok, it was big with an interesting architecture but there were neither furniture nor some more info about the royal family to give a better sense about the life there. some extra signs in each room with more info would make our visit much more interesting.
Average. The Palace is nice, if you don t have more nothing to do. It's not that big as people say, nothing extraordinary to see and it needs renovations.

Favorite place in Marrakch. Every inch in this place is impressive.. you will find a varity of attraction, the phenomenal interiors, the colors, the drawing on the ceilings, te gardens, the doors. the fountains,..If you are into photography I say give this place 2 hours: 1 hour for photograhy and 1 hour for just chilling in the garden or in the main fountain area and enjoying the natural peace of the place (unless interrupted by annoying tourists)

Lavish. Tiling, amazing carvings go see and use your imagination as to how this beautiful building once was. Unfortunately although there are fountains few have water but still worth a visit although preferably when there are not too many coaches visiting!

Nice to escape the sun and madness of the square. It was a pleasant way to kill an hour. It's close to the centre, easy to navigate. We didn't plan in advance for a tour guide but would recommend one as otherwise the history is lost ...
Fascinating details. Great way to spend an hour and get out of the sun.Fabulous and intricate panels and plasterwork in every room.It's inexpensive too, if you're on a budget

Beautiful Architecture. This palace is well worth a visit if only for the beautiful architecture. Consider taking a guide who can give you a full history of the palace and can point out the things of specific interest.

Nice visit. Interesting place,full of beautiful architecture.spent a morning wondering about here with a guide.n I've tourist attraction and offers refuge from the very hot sun.beatiful inner courtyards.
An Oasis on a Hot Day. The courtyard of the haram is especially interesting from a cultural perspective. There's a hidden doorway that connects the courtyard to the Sultan's suite.
Great Palace!. We really enjoyed this visit, With its stripped walls it is hard to imagine just how impressive this must have been in its heyday but it is a magnificent sight just as it stands today.
Reminiscent of Andalusia. Stepping into the Bahia Palace reminded me of the Alcázar of Seville. The tile work, arches, and gardens are simply magical. Visit this palace early and often.

The Bahia palace. This palace was interesting but was very hot on this day
The palace is very big and I was told that a minister once lived here, there's a lovely garden as well with lime trees growing... Lovely smells of flowers etc
Worth a visit... Lovely place

Worth a look.. After reading many recommendations to visit the palace we decided to give it a look. The intricately decorated ceilings and doorways are great for photographs as are the vast gardens and variety of flowers. I expect it would be a better experience with a proper tour guide who could give historical explanations about the rooms etc but if you're tight on money, 10 Durham gets you in for however long you wish to peruse the area.

Recommend a visit. Worth a visit but beware of the bus parties. We liked siting in the courtyard gardens waiting on the parties to go. Good to chill out. Architecture very ornate but to be honest I think the dar el said is more impressive and a lot quieter.
Nice palace. Beautiful and relaxing escape from the Medina. Worth to see preserved in a perfect state beautiful mosaics and carvings.

By far, the most amazing building in Marrakech!. Utterly beautiful. Only five minutes walk from our accommodation, this treasure literally took our breath away. It is cheaper by far than the museums and is simply jaw-dropping. A must :-)
Worth the visit. Definitely worth the visit to this place. Very cheap to get in and lots of photo opportunities. Also check out the tombs nearby.

Go for the peace and architecture, only 10 DHM (€1). Quiet former palace to walk through and see the layout and architecture of a former palace.Rooms are unfurnished and all the signs are in Arabic and French so we just had to guess what they might have been used for.Be confident you know where you're going as plenty of 'helpful' people will try and walk you round the block via their shops if you look lost and aren't confident of saying you're fine! (Happened to some other guests in our riad)
“Beautiful architecture". The place was awesome & the architecture on the building was breathtaking did not no were to look just beautiful and peaceful
Beautiful. A guided tour or independently go around and have a look at the history and architecture ...a must!!!
Beautiful mid city palace. Beautiful architecture and history inside the palace. Nice and calm as opposed to the madness of the city outside

One of the better attractions. This was one of the better Marrakech attractions. They have a lot of different fruit trees in courtyard and the artwork/designs on the ceilings and in the rooms was quite amazing. Very cheap entrance fee and worth a visit
Average . Lack of explanation inside the palace, and only in Arabic and French. Limited areas to wander as some parts are forbidden. Some tiles are broken so you need to watch where you are walking

Nice Palace, not very Royal. Great stop and tourist place for a short while.
Nice architecture and tiles in the building however apart from this there is little more to see!

Incredible architecture. Built in the 19th century this palace is beautiful and historic. One slight complaint is the lack of curation and guidance in English. But merely walking about this palace gives you a good understanding of what it was and you don't need curation to enjoy the splendid architecture and gardens.
Well worth the small entry fee.

I could live here!. This place was really pretty and I loved all of the detailing in the walls and ceiling. It was built for one of his many wives.
Can someone build be one please?

Beautiful architecture, a must see!. The Bahia palace is simply stunning in terms of decoration. It is still being restored to its former glory but you are very much left with the impression of what it was once like. It strikes a particular contrast with the surrounding area which even today is in much worse repair.It is well worth having a guide to explain the history of the place and point out some of the more interesting features, as there is precious little information displayed.Definitely somewhere to have seen on any trip to Marrakech!

Cheap and interesting. Only cost about 10dh to get in. The grounds are well kept and its interesting to look at the architecture. All the signs are in French and Arabic so take a phone with photo translation if you only speak English and care about reading stuff. That area of town also seems to be getting renovated. If you want a beer afterwards Pop around into the small square to Kosybar.

Royal visit. Walking the mile and a half from my hotel and soaking up the sights of the Medina en route, I was really immersed in the culture of this place even before I arrived. Set behind high walls, it is a haven of peace and quiet as one leaves behind the heat and the dust of the Medina. The gardens are lush and cool on entering at the gate in the wall. A short walk to the palace emerges at a modest entrance, and within its shaded walls and dark corridors there's a wealth of beautiful architecture.One can walk, undisturbed, from room to room. Most are unfurnished. This is not plush. But the ever present tiled floors and walls, doors, intricate windows, mirrors and exotic open courtyards were plentiful reward for the long walk and the tiny entrance fee.

Fantastic, don't miss it. Probably the best 10 dirhams you can spend in Marrakech. Stunning buildings with an amazing sense of geometric order - like stepping in a beautiful book of Islamic art that suddenly came to life. Definitely worth a visit, and worth lingering and exploring at a slow pace.
An architectural Must. It's just around the corner where we have our house. It's a stunning photogenic place that shows some of the grandeur of Marrakech.

Cool place to visit. . The decor is stunning and is only 10 MAD to enter.
About 10 minutes to walk from the centre of the Medina.
Well worth an hour of your day.

Gorgeous walk through. A really beautiful example of local architecture and history, well preserved in the city center. A bargain entry price (10 dirham) but wish they had information provided in English.
Great mosaics. Great place, well preserved and restored. Definitely worth visiting. We didn't see any explanation, might be useful for tourists visiting by their selfs.

Lovely to see but bring a guide or guidebook. The decorations are endless and lovely; carvings, mosaics etc. The rooms are all bare. Information inside is almost non-existent and in English completely non-existent. One of the few attractions we visited with no guides hanging around out front so if you want the backstory bring one along or read up beforehand. Allow 1-2 hours for a comprehensive look.

Beautiful for €1. We visited midday. Walked through the Jewish quarter and followed a school tour to find it. Sellers will try distract you on your way. The palace gardens were very well kept and an attraction itself. The entrance is 10 dirham(€1) for a self guided tour. There are explanations on the wall in French. Beautiful Moroccan architecture. A hidden gem I would recommend a visit.
Top grade lintels. If your are into lintels and painted ceilings then this is the place for you. The detail on the ceilings is quite amazing. Well worth a visit as you stroll round the city.
Beautiful Classic Moroccan Architecture. Lovely, intricate tilework and woodwork in geometric patterns. Small gardens and fountains provide respite from the African heat.
Excellent experience. If you have curiosity to know how the life on a sultanate would be, you will love this palace.Additionally, it's architecture also deserves a visit.Must go.

Beautiful--try to go with a guide. I enjoyed this treasure. The design of the palace is lovely-- A very beautiful display of Islamic architecture from the past two centuries. I really was interested in the history and understanding the purpose of each room. My guide did a great job weaving stories and facts throughout the tour and also gave us a larger understanding of the diverse customs of Moroccan people. I do not think I would have enjoyed it as much without a guide.

Beautiful palace . Such a beautiful Moroccan palace to
visit. The designs and architecture is amazing. Best time to go is first thing in the morning to miss the crowds and allow you to get photos without people in them :)
Deff worth the visit! Plus it's cheap.
Amazing detail. Very easy to get to. The architecture and detail on everything was amazing to see. I feel sorry for the person who had to tile the place.

Beautiful!. Very beautiful, cheap, and easy to get to. Definitely worth a visit! We stayed for 20-30 minutes and took lots of pictures. It is self-guided so you will mostly be taking in the beautiful tiles and woodwork in the palace.

Beautiful palace. Beautiful to walk through all the rooms. There were no English guides available when we went, so we were kind of walking around aimlessly. Would have been great to have someone tell us about the palace etc

Faded glory. With restoration ongoing, it's work in progress. The splendour of the buildings can still be seen in the beautiful plaster work and ceiling carving of cedar wood. Get there early to avoid the crowds.

Worth a £1. ....but nothing more. Lovely carved wood ceilings and some nice small gardens but it's no Thai temple or Alhambra so don't get your hopes up. All the rooms are empty, no furniture or such and all the info is in Arabic and French but no English.

Nothing Special. Having gone to Thailand earlier this year, I must say , this was dissapointing... You are left to yourself , there is no or very little explanation... I had high hopes but ... nothing special...
Nice!. Nice place with amazing architecture! Recommend it to everyone! It's a must see in Marrakesh! It doesn't take long to find or visit it.

Hidden Gem. A must see, a beautiful palace hidden away. looks very deceptive from the outside but it grows and grows and the rooms are truly amazing and the art work and tiles will leave you speech less.
We loved the Bahia palace.

Nice stroll, good escape. We enjoyed about an hour here. A good break from life in the medina. The entry fee is very reasonable which is good as there are no descriptions as to what you're seeing (with the exception of one French/Arabic sign we found in the queens bedroom. Still it was worth seeing the beauty and peacefulness of the place.

Haven. Beautiful and peaceful. A haven from the hustle and bustle of the main square. Costs around £10 to enter and there are various sections of the palace which are preserved very well. The gardens and courtyard are amazing

Visit to a key sight. Spent approx an hour at this historical sight. Entry was 10 MAD each. We arrived there by a Caleche (horse drawn carriage) from Jemaa-el-Fna square at a cost of 70 MAD. Yes it was expensive but a bit like going on the gondolas in Italy, something that has to be done. The building it self is serene and well decorated in historical architecture. We spent approx 40 mins there having arrived there at approx. 10:30. As we left the crowds were getting larger so perfect timed.I think there are guides available to hire as we saw many groups with guides speaking different languages.Wold recommend as one the must see sights in the old town.

If ceramics and paintwork on wood are what floats your boat.....go here!! Good value. Can be a bit busy so go there about one hour before it closes. Go shopping nearby and feel like a local !! Don't forget your camera !!

One of the very best!. I didn't expect the palace to have such exquisite carvings, paintings, stucco work etc. Beautifully and tastefully painted ceilings, arches with stucco work, a room with colourful glass panes creating magical patterns on floor and rich tilework everywhere!

Mrs Sharma. We went to view Bahia Palace whilst in Marrakech. It was a beautiful palace with absolutely world class architectural work! The walls, floor and ceilings were just magnificent! You have to see this to enjoy the beauty!

Great find! . We did not visit as part of a tour, instead we visited alone and we were happy to do this so that we could walk around at our own pace.The building was not to crowded, many rooms were empty which allowed us to fully appreciate the architecture.This palace was one of the most impressive that we visited whilst in Marrakech, I would recommend visiting.

Interesting..... I would recommend taking a half or full day tour of all the historic sights in Marrakech, you wouldn't discover half of these places otherwise. The palace is beautiful and with a really interesting history with its various cultures etc, a must see...
Nice Palace. This was a nice palace to visit. The admission coast was so little, it was nice to just walk around for 20 minutes and enjoy the architecture and design.

Lovely palace - needs a guide. Luckily, we visited here as part of a tour of other monuments and it was needed otherwise you would have no idea what anything was due to lack of signs or any info sheets.The history and importance was interesting, and the palace is certainly well kept. and worth going to see. The main courtyard is impressive and to find out about the importance of the Riads and why there were different size bedrooms.Even with a guide we had seen it all in about an hour.

Unexpected nice and beautiful interior. We were totally surprised by the beauty of this place. The detail work put in the walls and ceiling as also in the floors was impressive. It's a nice tucked away place with nice gardens and quite atmosphere. Totally worth a visit. We really enjoyed it, away the crowds of touristy Marrakech.

Ok for a quick walk through. Palace was nice and beautiful to look at - can be done in half an hour maximum.
Located right near the Royal Palace. It's a quick walk from the main square.
Cheap entrance fee at 10 dirham too.

Interesting. A beautiful Palace tucked away in the back streets of Marrakech. A nice way to spend an hour with some beautiful rooms and gardens full of oranges, pomegranates and avocados. Very cheap to get in and there are guides available if you want a tour and to find out about the history of the Palace.
Beautiful Bahia Palace. This great monument was built by Ba Ahmed ben Moussa as a riad with beautiful interior gardens. There is a great Council Chamber with painted and perforated ceiling.

Worth a visit!. Definitely worth the very little money that you'll need to pay for the entrance (a little over 10 Dihrams if I remember correctly). After a small garden that doesn't do justice to the rest of the complex, the visit goes through a number of incredibly beautiful restored rooms and gardens. We only had our lonely planet and the visit was good, but having a guide is probably worth it.

Possibly the best value in Marrakech. It's hard to believe this only cost 10dh to enter. The walk from the pay booth to the entrance is probably worth half of that!After visiting a couple of pleasant but relatively bland rooms and courtyards, we wondered what we had entered, but that soon changed. We then walked through a succession of stunning rooms and huge courtyards, plus gorgeous gardens.Very good value.

Beautiful palace!. It is only 10 dirhams to visit the palace, beautiful architecture especially the cieling and the mosaics work. Great place for taking pictures. The only downside that no any sort of information to explain to you about the palace but it still a must see on Marrakech.

Africa, Middle-East or ... China. nice palace - as usual in Morocco - a lot of wood masterpieces, carved stuccoes but some of the parts being strange eclectic - looking a bit like Chinese pavilions ;)
"So beautiful". The intricacies of the design and architecture was worth the visit through this huge maze of rooms and hallways and gardens

Worth the money. This Palace together with Jardin Majorelle were the most beautiful places we have been to in Marrakesh. We have not seen Badi palace as it was closed during refurbishment. The architecture and the atmosphere are just amazing, must see for every traveller in Marrakesh.

Very cheap- entry only 10dh. Be aware there are no signs in English aside from one outside entrance and it isn't furnished at all but for 10dh fantastic value to visit. Gorgeous ceilings in particular.
So beautiful. The intricacies of the design and architecture was worth the visit through this huge maze of rooms and hallways and gardens. Picture perfect

Make sure to include this on your visit to Marrakech. Beautiful palace with stunning architecture and design. Our guide spoke about the interesting history of the palace and we really enjoyed our visit to this site.
Very Impressive Palace. Loved all the beautiful Moroccan tiles and the intricate woodwork of the doors and ceilings.So much work has gone into this palace.
Amazing place!. So pleased this place didn't close at 430 as advertised as this is a place not to be missed. The grounds and buildings are beautiful.

Interesting, but kind of run down. I was expecting a wel kept edifice when I read about the Bahia palace. Most of the historical locations we visited in Marrakech were painted, clean and overflowing with beautiful plants.Although this location is basically beautiful, it really needs regular maintenance to make it look like a former palace. Perhaps if they charged more money, they would have the funds to properly restore it.
Part of our Marrakech tour.... One of the highlights of our visit. Would strongly recommend taking time to add Bahia palace to your visit. An impressive palace and gardens.
Beautiful . Can't take enough pictures to share the beauty! It's absolutely beautiful! Every turn you take and there is a opportunity to take pictures!
Unique place, interesting ornaments. Visited palace while in Marrakech, nice gardens, beautiful ornaments, if you have good guide nice stories.
Absolutely beautiful!. A must-see in Marrakesh. Beautiful architecture and decorations, lovely garden. It's close to the centre and the entrance fee is just 10 dh (cca 1 eur).
Nice sealing 😊. The entrance is very economic, the place is wide and clean , but there's nothing more interesting here than the sealing because the place empty ( no paintings or frames,etc)
Worth a visit. Some really nice architecture, and alot of history to see. It was only 10Dh, so you can't really go wrong.
Do not miss. Bahia is fantastically beautiful and exotic. The Arab architecture surrounded by truly North African garden is a perfect mix. Recommended!

A Gem of a Palace. To the south side of the Jemaa El Fnaa, the large public square, lies this beautiful traditional Meroc palace. A must to visit although all the visitor's information plaques are in Arabic and French only. A mere 10 Dihrams to get in and you won't be disappointed.

Worth seeing. We really enjoyed this visit, You can only imagine how magnificent this palace once was,stunning decors of a rich civilisation. It shows all the richness and complexity of Moroccan traditionnal masons and other craftsmen. Definately a must to see on your trip. Take your camera. Not far from the souks

Beautiful, you should definitely visit!. We went to Bahia Palace in the afternoon and it was as beautiful as all the guide books say - the ceilings, the walls, the tiles, the doors and the gardens - everything beautiful and calm. This was our favourite place to visit (and entry only Dh10 per person).

Really magnificent. Although this palace is hard to find, once there it is a hidden gem. It only costs 10 dirhams to get in and it is a lot bigger than it looks from the outside. Also it's open every day. The decoration is ornate and the architecture is beautiful.
Serene but not much to see. Beautiful and cheap at 10Dhs however there wasn't an awful lot to see. There was an expensive cafe in there. That's about it for this place unfortunately.

Architectural beauty. The palace is a beauty, the mosaic used in all the rooms and the paintings in the ceilings is something to behold. However if you would like to know something about the palace history you will have to hire a guide, because there are only few signs with descriptions of the rooms, and that is written in French and Arabic.

Beautifully calm. Agree with all the other reviewers here, lovely buildings, cool and tranquil when you need a break from the bustle of this city.We did it without any guides, maybe missed out on some fact finding but was nice just to amble around and enjoy everything in its own right.The exhibitions of "art" didn't do it for us but might appeal to others. But it doesn't get in the way either.Recommended
Beutiful. 10Dhms to see some of the most beautiful and ornate decorated rooms and buildings, giving relief from the midday heat (2pm to 4pm would be best). You must take a camera.
Beautiful retreat from the heat. Well worth visiting this palace, a great place to wander around and appreciate the beautiful architecture and mosiacs.

Just beautiful. An amazing palace. Truly remarkable Moroccan architecture. A must see if in Marrakech.
You are allowed in the private palace of the Prime Minister appointed by the king. We had a private tour guide. He was very knowledgeable about Moroccan history and we learned a lot about the Muslim faith.
Amazing mosaics. Was really beautiful to explore all the alcoves of the palace. Incredible mosaic courtyards one minute and then luscious gardens in the next.

Simply beautiful and very ornate. The Palace is gorgeous with alot of intricate and ornate design. There is a garden at the entrance and small garden in the interior that then leads to anothert interior courtyard.

Go visit for an hour or so. Just to get away from the madness that is Marrakech you can visit this place for very little and it is a little interesting even if it wouldn't be the top of the list of visits.

Amazing architecture. Beautiful . We visited this palace on our last day in Marrakech and I'm so glad we did. The building is absolutely amazing and the architecture is so impressive. The admission fee isn't a lot at all and we had a really nice day here. Lovely for taking good pictures and just enjoying all the scenery. Would definitely recommend a visit

Interesting . There is a fee of 10 dirham into the palace. There is no guide on offer to show you around, although we had our own guide. It's interesting to see the rooms, although it is just rooms no furniture or pictures on display.
Amazing haven.. Amazing place where to go from the madness in the big square. Beautiful tiles and patterns. Majestic.

Breathtaking. This place was a real surprise. The palace was gorgeous, so ornate and sprawling. The grounds were the absolute highlight, both outside the palace and the cool courtyards within. The art exhibition going on during our visit really added to our enjoyment. A must-visit, we still talk about it now we are back home.
Gorgeous Palace. Gorgeous palace to visit. The rooms and the colors are marvellous! Always better to have a tour guide to tell you the history of the palace.
Stunning. Amazing building right in the middle of the medina, architecture was stunning and took 7 years to complete, well worth a visit.
Not worth the visit. We briefly walked around the palace, I felt there wasn't much to do. I wouldn't have missed out if I hadn't visited.

Amazing Architecture!. We stayed in a riad a few blocks from this palace. It is stunning. Definitely walk through, admire the architecture, picture it full of lavish furniture and celebrations when it was in use, and examine the detail in the tile work.

wonderful palace. A treasure fabulous gardens with organs pomegranates figs etc. Superb craftsmanship on display in the intricate designs in magnificent wooden ceilings and stain glass windows. Some of the wonderful floor tiles were coming up and the water features were not working . The place is full of cats who have ancient cat flaps cut into in the magnificent doors. Full of history which a guide will impart great place to visit on a guided tour, for an hour or so

Designing people, this is for you!. Since this palace is empty, it's not about furnishings, but finishes instead. The walls and ceilings have intricate designs in wood, stone and tile. Nice to have a telephoto lens on your camera (or bring binoculars) to really see the details and colors in the ceiling designs.

A Decent Time Filler. - Ornate ceilings- Not too well kept- RepetitiveEntrance cost a nominal 10DH/person (approx 80p), the well kept greenery upon entry boasting oranges was promising, however once we had seen the first room with beautifully ornate, high, carved ceilings the rest was fairly repetitive, the whole palace is quite small and can be done at a comfortable pace in half an hour. It's a real shame the whole palace is not brilliantly well kept as there were original tiles coming up from the floor, also navigating around required a bit of guess work due to the lack of directional signs, large sections of the palace could easily have been missed. The whole thing would have been made nicer if the water features were on/working. This being said the ornate features were nice to look at, all in all, a decent time filler.
Fabulous!. Historically interesting. Well laid out and easy to walk around yourself. Easy to find and well located inside the Medina.

Amazing! Thank you MarrakecDayTrips. We came here as part of a tour organised by MarrakechDayTrip,com. Our local guide was outstanding and he carefully explained the history of the palace and in doing so the background to the French period of recent Moroccan history. This is one of the most beautiful buildings in the city, with stunning craftsmanship in every detail throughout the property and great histoty. Really enjoyed my visit.

An Average Palace. You only get access to a quarter of this palace as the rest is still in use. Once you have seen other palaces, this one is only average but the learned history is interesting if you have a guide.
Bahia Palace OK. Lots of traditional architecture and decoration. A small fee to visit but worth it for a stroll around a clam interesting place

A highlight!. One of the most impressive sights in Marrakesh. We spent almost 2 hours in there, the entrance fee is very small (1,-€ I think) and the building is absolutely amazing! I recommend it to all people who like the typical morrocan walls, decorated with mosaics and beautiful colours!

A piece of history!. The Bahia Palace is a beautiful testimony of the splendor of the past. I enjoyed the architecture, the spacious rooms and courtyards, and the gardens. However, as in many places in Marrakech, I regretted that the museums are so empty and put more emphasis on the physical structures than on what used to inhabit them. There is no trace or indication of how people occupied these palaces, of their furniture, the objects they used, of their customs, and there are usually extremely few explanations available. In spite of this, it is definitely a place to visit!

Interesting Almoravide Palace. Bahia in arabic means stunning. This Almoravide palace used to be one of the best ever built, with regards to the power of the Almoravide empire back in the time, Though many features of the palace has been wiped out, yet you can enjoy its architecture and the amazing "minbar", 1000 years old wooden autel offered by a andalusian prince to Youssef Ibn Tachfine.

Amazing. Wonderful structure and gardens, it was one of the best day I spend in Marrakech. The palace was really interesting to visit and a nice place to spend some good time, the decorations and zelliji were truly beautiful!!

Good renovation. A few years ago the palace was in a miserable state. However since it has been renovated his ancient beauty has been restores thanks to the Moroccan craftsmen who restored it during two years. The garden is spectacular and so are the rooms that can be visited. It also offers a relaxing resting place away from the busy souks.
Not to be missed. Well worth a visit to see this magnificent building. To avoid the heat go in the morning and take a leisurely stroll around this palace. Just a short walk from the main square.

Wow factor . Great place to take photos. Would have been nice to have literature of the history of the palace displayed around the venue. Beautiful mosaic work all around the palace. Relatively easy to see everything (we did a tour in 30minutes). Nice place to find a corner and read a book or listen to music / meditate. Visiting once is enough but worth a see as it is a good getaway from the medina madness of you want some soothing quiet time.
Great place . One of the most beautiful palace I ever visited and I seen a lot of places on my travels.excusite architecture and decor.

Dream state . When we traveled Marrakech we were just open to wherever the day took us & to be in this palace made us very calm & happy.Well attended, we decided to just take it in without the guide & have no regrets.Luckily my travel partner speaks many languages & they were able to catch snippets of what we wanted to hear.Absolutely lovely!
A miniture Alhambra!. You can see the Catalania influence with the Moorish architecture in this beautiful little palace in the city of Marrakech.

Beautiful building . Stunning looking building inside, not much to see but it's still worth a look at the intricate work inside. Outside you can sit and have drinks(non alcoholic) with the locals and visit the Jewish quarters where you can buy argon oils and great spices. Local people were all very friendly, they will try and get you to go the Jewish markets etc but if you don't want to just politely say so. Costs 10 Dirhams each which is approx 80p. You can easily find your way back to the medina on foot which is about 20 min walk.
Holiday . Very interesting worth a visit the only down side it's lots of steps people with walking difficulties could struggle
It's empty house. At the beginning it's hard to find entry gate. Quiet place and empty place in eventful meste. Entry fees are around 2 Euro.
Disappointed. Was a bit disappointed,the palace is just empty rooms, I found it a bit boring. The grounds are nice.

Living History in Bahia Palace. We visited Bahia Palace with guide, Mohammed who was procured by Aziz, of Dadani Destinations. We very much enjoyed Mohammed. He explained so much about the architecture and history of Bahia Palace. We never would have appreciated the history of this palace without his input. There is not much there posted by way of signs or literature, so I would highly recommend hiring a guide or doing your homework before you visit.The craftsmanship and work by the artisans is stunning to behold and the place is quite vast in size. I even had a "déjà vu" moment there and my guide joked that perhaps I had been there in a previous life as a princess. I assured him, if I was here in a previous life, it was only as help!The palace is still in use, but most of it is open to the public. If you are in Marrakech, Bahia Palace is not to be missed.

Interesting piece of Moroccan history. Visited the palace recently and must say enjoyed a good hour looking round at some very interesting architecture and local styles, very colourful too. In the heart of Marrakech, easy to find and cheap to get in, seems popular and a guide would be useful.
Great architecture. The detail in the design of the walls and archways is amazing. So ornate. I recommend going with a guide since there's no audio guide.

Very pretty and well worth a visit. Lots of vibrant colours and beautiful architecture. Well worth a trip. Reasonable entry fee as well. Advise going early as it was getting quite clogged with tour groups later.
Great culture trip!. Glad I visited . The experience was awesome. Our guide was very informative and it was interesting to hear the history of the palace. Scenery was amazing.

Interesting and Beautiful. I had a guided tour around the palace and I would say that this is a must when visiting. Otherwise, yes, you are visiting a beautiful building with some nice gardens, but you won't get to know about the history or the Hollywood glamour of the place.

Stunning . Went on a trip with Thomson, absolutely stunning in here and it's free! This is where the Prime Minister used to live until 1912 (from what I can remember) . You can see where the old school was and where each of his wife's stayed. There are also some lovely courtyards but best going with a guide so you can understand the history within. Definately worth a visit .
Such a beautiful place!. Magnificent architecture! Beautiful buildings and examples of Moorish decorations. Plan an hour to visit it all!
Beautiful. This was one of my favourite visits in Marrakech - so beautiful and peaceful. Designs were so intricate.
Great Place to See!!. Wonderful palace and grounds to visit. The mosaics are stunning. Spend a few hours here - totally worth it.
Peaceful and Pretty. Very peaceful once inside considering the area this is in. Photo opportunities are great, lots if colour and nice gardens.
not too impresive. we were a bit disappointed. It would be much nicer if there were more descriptions included so the visit would be more informative

Pretty to look at. Cheap entry price and easy to find. It's a lovely structure and we enjoyed the panelling and windows. It would have been nice to see a bit more about the culture of Morrocco and the history of the royals. All the signs are in French and Arabic, so if you don't speak those then do a bit of research before you go.

Stunning. I couldn't say which of the patios that are part of this palace I liked more. The details of the decoration from the mosaic floors to the carved ceilings will leave you speachless. Absolutely worth the visit, and take some time to take it all in or you will miss details that are worth being seen. We didn't have a guide with us, but a guided visit is a good idea if one wants to know how the different areas were used and by whom and all the history behind this palace.

A beautiful breaktacking palace. We arrived early and got to start our visit before large organised tours arrived and it was lovely to quietly appreciated this lovely palace, which had just been restored.The main courtyard with its bright colours was amazing and the garden area was quite small but again very beautiful.One of the highlights of our visit to Marrakech - we would definitely visit again.

Nice architecture. I nice enough building, but not a patch on the Alhamba in Granada or the Seville Alcazar. Both of these are a similar Moorish design. We took out time and were there less than an hour, but it was only 10D entry!!
Really beautiful and a very interesting exhibition there. For me, this visit summarised the beauty of Marrakech architecture. It was a brilliant place and the art exhibition there was fascinating.
Idyllic. This is an amazing little oasis in the middle of a crazy city! Idyllic & beautiful! Leave the noise behind you when you enter this palace.

Palace . Great place to visit, well worth the 10Dh. We spent a good few hours there, well worth the visit for some good culture and history. Tag along with another party with a guide that speaks your language to here all the detail and history for free!

Beautiful palace that was. Another oasis in a bustling city. You can see what a beautiful palace this was, and still is. Incredible tiling and stunning stained glass windows that look amazing especially when the sun shines through. Worth a visit.
Amazing visit. One of the historic palaces of Marrakech, I had a great and memorable time visiting this palace. A lovely place.

Easy to Find and well worth a vist. The cost of visiting this Palace is only 10 dirham per person and is well worth the visit, The building is vast and stunning please look up at the ceiling's as so much work has gone into them. the courtyards are a cooling place to sit and just relax
Tour Guide makes it worth it. So wonderful to learn all about the rich history of the palace, The architecture and styling is impressive!

Truly Beautiful & Inspirational. For only 10 dirham you get to visit the Bahia Palace and you will be glad you went. The place is stunning with the tiling, wood work and the little cats too. There is a beautiful outdoor area with plants etc and large courtyard areas with water features. This is a must visit attraction and happy to give it a 5 star rating.
Beautiful. Perfect for a very hot day, the architecture and colors are beautiful inside and you can wonder around for hours, definitely a place to visit!!!
Visit. Don't expect it to be on the same scale as palaces in other countries as you will be throughly disappointed, appreciate it for what it is. For just 10 Dirhams
Bahia Palace. Not sure, if we could go inside the palace as our taxi driver just took us around the palace! Apparently, the king lives in this palace with his family.

Stunning. So much to see! . A lovely place to visit; lots to see, some shade on very hot days, beautiful architecture, pretty gardens. The Palace seems to go on and on; it's rooms and big open courtyards are just beautiful. I really felt transported in time, despite their being no props, pictures or furniture to help paint a picture.Colour everywhere. Lots of great photo oops. I really enjoyed my visit here.

A palace with beautiful ceilings, arches and history. We visited Bahia Palace when the temperature was 35 deg c plus and found the cool rooms and corridors a perfect place for a 2 hour visit. We had not researched anything about the Palace, however, our guide Youssef was very knowledgeable. If you are 'going it alone' ,reading up prior to your visit would be worthwhile.The amazing and intricate tiles, carvings, arches and floors were beautiful.

Gorgeous. Really beautiful place to visit. You can only visit a part of the building but it's still a lot. The vegetation is beautiful. The place is a little oasis of peace in the madness of Marrakech
Amazing!. Arabic, Andalusian and French influences- it's a beautiful palace. By all means take an official guide, it's worth it.
Very Interesting. Not the easiest of places to find, but inside the palace is very interesting, the architecture being unusual for the place and time. Explanations are only in French or Arabic.

A lesson in history. Marrakech is lovely place to visit and has so many different attractions including a lesson in history. Bahia palace is one of the place you should visit if you have any interest in history. Even if you don't it's still worth a visit for the beauty and architecture.Some of the structures are not in good shape and it is a bit disappointing that the state don't look after some of these historic buildings as they should.Never the less it's worth the visit and only takes one hour.

Beautifull P(a)lace. Plenty to see in well preserved monument.Love to see the details in evey wall, roof and collumn. History isn't always written and sometimes can only best be represented. Beautifull architechtural, stone and wood art with a large refreshing garden, at a minimum price of entry. Really worth.

Amazing palace. Really beautiful palace and the entrance fee is cheap. It is what you would expect from an african palace, with its explicit designs and open spaces. Here you will find a few signs telling you the story of the place, but they are in french..
The best Marrakech attraction. Aside from the excursions, the spas and the fabulous restaurants, this is the best thing to do in Marrakech, don't miss it.

Very impressive. The age of these palaces and tombs in Morocco just boggle the mind. They are so full of history and beautifully built. We had a private guide who gave us thorough information about the palace which I would recommend anyone do so as not to miss anything about the palace. The gardens are very beautiful as well.
interesting place. The place is veruy interesting to visit and te be include in the monuments of marrakech Visit with a Guide or by self is easy to get in through the place of jammaa el fna

Must do - loved it!. It's cheap first of all : 1 euro and this is a huge palace that you will discover with different ambiances, that was amazing, we really enjoyed the visit and the buildings are gorgeous.
It's better to have a guide so you understand the history and meaning/function of each room.
Worth the visit. Nice palace and grounds and great examples of mosaic tiling and fantastic ceilings, the visit is only going to take around 1 hour but is worth it.

Very Unique Palace. There isn't much to see when you are inside and I was not happy that I had to pay so much money to admire the walls, my opinion is that this place should be free of charge to the public

Wouldn't you love to live like this?. This is a worthy place to visit. The gorgeous tiles, the serene garden and courtyards, the birds, even the lovely fireplaces all speak to a lifestyle many would be happy to pursue.
Beautiful palace!. Loved the architecture at this place! We took some amazing picture of the tile, and the woodwork with the family. A must see if you are Marrakesh.

Looks nice but not really spectacular. Just to have a half an hour to look and that's it. Had a very long winded tour-guide who was trying to talk louder than other guides, very crowded a very tedious experience.
Beautiful. Good place to visit, entrance is cheap. Lovely spaces but if you want to know about it either read up about it or you will need a guide as there is no information otherwise.

Nice Place to Visit!. This is a nice palace, it's definitely worth seeing but be sure to arrange for a guide or read ahead because not much information is provided at this place. Without that information, it be harder to appreciate the beauty and history of the building as it is empty of any type of furniture or trace of life. The entrance fee (50 MAD) is reasonable.
Photographer's dream. The attention to detail here is superb. A fantastic mix of mosaic throughout. Great angles, great design and a peaceful place.
Beautiful Bahia Palace! Go visit!. Beautiful interior, lovely tile work. Bright colours, stunning architecture and cheap entry fee, only 10dhs. Lovely and well looked after external garden too!

Stunning!. Palace of greater in Marakech! Distinguished buildings, beautiful ornaments surrounded by green nature.
Must visit!
When craftsmanship was everything. You'll marvel at the tile work, carved wood, and courtyards. Though not ancient, it is still a must-see.
Great Place. Its a great place to spend a couple of hours, worth visiting when in Marrakech. We spent almost 3 hours walking around the gardens.

Good place to visit - historic and worth the trip. This palace is on the southern part of Medina. Once you get used to the locations, it is an easy walk to this palace. It is quiet in there (probably, because the guides are do not have incentives to visit). However, the architecture and murals are amazing and worth the visit

Enjoyable tour. A large very colourful palace, had a guided tour organised via the hotel I was stopping in. Very informative information, great place to take photos and I took loads. The grounds were beautiful to look round the guide was very informative about some of the plants and trees. Inside the palace the architecture was beautiful must of taken years to complete again the guide knew his stuff. I enjoyed the tour. Not of interest to small children,
Amazing colour. We visited here as part of a guided tour of Marrakech, and the architecture and colour was stunning. I particularly recommend a photos shop in the large courtyard with the fountain!
Another large palace in morocco. Just another palace in Morocco. Only one we were allowed into though. Very large but publis only allowed to see very small section. Lovely architecture
Great value . It was really nice to visit on a very hot day as there were lots of cool shaded parts of the garden. Was very cheap to get in (10 DIR?) and was well worth it.
A must see. It's a pretty palace, which you can walk through at your leisure, no rush, very interesting and a def. must see. Entrance is only 10 D for adult (cheap!)
Very cheap. Good price but needs more information in each room to explain the history behind it. A bit difficult to find.

Calm and pretty . There were a lot of roadworks going on in the streets around the palace but as soon as you got through the gate you forgot about the hustle and bustle. Beautiful courtyards in white tiles with shade if you needed it. Only 10 dh to get in (not even a pound!!!)

Small but interesting. Visited here as part of a guided tour. Lots of history and beautiful ornate carvings and mosaics. A lot of the water features in Marrakesh are dry due to lack of winter rain but there was a fountain in the middle of this courtyard. I thought it was beautiful but very warm. The quadrangle with the trees was a welcome relief from the heat.Note: there are areas you are not allowed into and when we were there lots of furniture being stored.

Average. This is a beautiful palace but it didnt have much of a "wow" factor for me. It seemed pretty average considering all the rich culture and history in Marrakesh. The plants in the entrance were absolutely gorgeous and well preserved. This may be a good destination if you have a tour guide. Otherwise, you're sort of just wandering around a bunch of rooms and gardens. There aren't any signs that explain anything to you. It would be helpful to have more information on this palace
Well worth the visit. I loved the tiles, the windiest and the doors in this palace, one of my favourites in Morocco, well worth the 10 dirham.

Simple and serene!!!. The entrance has beautiful orange trees on either side of the walkway... The palace can be visited to have a look at some finely crafted wood work on the ceilings of the palace and the stone work on the floors... Its not all that royal though!!!!
Could be. Nothing special. All you can see is mosaics on the walls and garden. There's nothing inside. If you are around, why not to go, but don't expect miracles.

This is well worth a visit but I strongly suggest with a guide.. We cam e here as part of a tour. Our local guide was outstanding and he carefully explained the history of the palace and in doing so the background to the French period of recent Moroccan history. It was fascinating stuff and the palace and its surrounds encapsulates it all.

Beautiful mosaic tiling and immaculate gardens...enjoy the serenity.. Take your time to explore the beautiful mosaic tiles on the walls and floor of this interesting Palace.Many photo opportunity. The water fountains in the courtyards and the immaculate gardens ...makes it a perfect serene place to spend a nice morning.
Architectural delight. One of the most beautiful buildings in the city, and with a great history. There are stunning ceilings, court yards & works of art available to view. Really enjoyed my visit.
Beautiful tiles and woodwork. Definitely worth seeing this gem of a palace and gardens. No two rooms were alike and all were spectacular. Suggest hiring a guide.

Tranquil beaury. A 30min stroll from Jemaa El Fna Square, past busting streets and alleys, finds you at the Bahia Palace. Empty rooms, fountains and lovely gardens are well worth an hour of your time, best spent with a guide or guide book so you appreciate what you're looking at and walking through.No hint of commercialisation, and only 75p entrance fee.An important part of the city's history and well worth a visit.

A Glimpse into The Past. A wonderful example of the old extravagance of the Sultans. A peaceful stroll through the past. Empty, unfurnished rooms, beautiful mosaics and carved woodworking with ceilings worth getting a crick in your neck for and a cool lovely central garden.

Beautiful place. I had a guide booked by hotel show me around so he was able to explain all about the history and signicance of this place. But definitely appreciate the gardens and architecture nonetheless. Guide was 25 euro for 3 hours so good value especially as I was a female traveller on my own gave me the confidence to go back and negotiate the area by myself!
Beautiful Palace. The Bahia Palace a beautiful, with stunning craftsmanship in every detail throughout the property. Well worth visiting!

Nice attraction to see. Our tour guide took us here and had a good visit.There are a lot of people here so be careful with your personal items.What I found interesting was that there was a fake palm tree where the speakers were hidden..very smart thinking!
Beautiful . Beautiful architecture. Loved the Moroccan tiles, the intricate filigree and the carved woodwork. A must see.

Floor to Ceiling Beauty. Entrance fee is 10Dh which is a steal. Located off a non-descript busy medina street, it would be easy to miss if you didn't know it was there. Fourteen years in the making using the best artisans in Morocco. "Bahia" means beautiful and it is. Intricate carved door panels and ceilings. French guests were entertained here and the French eventually evicted the Moroccans and made it their headquarters in the early 20th century. Worth a visit and many photos.

A must see . Bahia palace was maybe the most beautiful place I have ever been in my life. It was peaceful and the architecture and decor is stunning.If you like Islamic patterns and tiles then you have to come here. It's just room after room of breathtaking design. And only 10DH for entry (about 60p).

Beautiful palace to visit!. Take the street down the left side of the Cafe of de France in the big square and you will after passing yet more shops eventually arrive at the Bahia Palace. The entry charge is about 20 dirhams each which compared to some other places is incredibly cheap. The palace is a couple of large Riads with big beautiful courtyards in the centres. The style of the Windows and the colourful ceilings are just lovely - don't forget your camera! Wandering in and out of the rooms leisurely, taking photos and just enjoying the calm and quiet is a lovely way to while away and hour or two. There are quite a few areas that could do with having some money spent on them but I think if they put the entrance fee up a little they would be able to achieve this. Put this place on your list to visit - it will be worth it!

Last day surptise. Waiting for the taxi to take us for our 10pm flight!!! And we're looking for something to do. Trip advisor was giving good reviews for this attraction. So off we trekked. Found easily, phew, and only 10 dirams, rooms were empty but the wall and ceiling decorations were the best we have seen and very very plentiful. Best was the large courtyard with a palm tree background looking one way and little wispy clouds looking the other. Used up a couple of hours wandering round before heading to a nearby cafe for lunch. Waiter wearing Arsenal shirt so hit it off with Lynn. No matter where you are gooners find each other. Great meal with proper chips. Great finish to the week
Worth a visit. . Very pretty palace and was taken there by a private guide. Only 10 dirhams to get in. Interesting to see and lovely orange trees.
fantastic historical palace. Bahia palace visit is a must you go back in history it is a well preserved palace you have to give good time to check all specially the ceilings just amazing

Amazing visit. A revealing piece of architecture of the revival palaces built in the nineteenth century Morocco. The use of marbles mixed with gardens and fountains is an inspiration for modern architecture.

Very good for the price. The entrance to Bahia palace doesn't give you the best impression at first. It's situated on a random busy road in the middle of the Medina. Entrance was 10 dirham (roughly 70p) - but after exploring the palace I would have paid a lot more! The palace inside is beautifully decorated and very large, there is a very well maintained garden as well. The palace was very quiet when we visited (3pm on a Sunday) and the only criticism is that there was nowhere to buy water or to sit down and have a drink. Bahia palace could really do with a small shop or a cafe - but other than that it is really worth a visit if you're in Marrakech!
Beautiful. Amazing Palace. I went there after lunch and It was relatively calm. The Palace and the gardens were manificient! Definitely a must see in the Medina.

Gorgeous palace - must see!. Gorgeous palace and very large - takes a while to get through it all. The details and restorations are amazing. Great job on the restorations and definitely worth going to visit in the middle of Marrakech.
Interesting place. Spent about an hour going around looking an the ceilings and doors. We had a tour guide and all visitors were in groups. Naomi lovely gardens surrounded
A good visit. We went there in the afternoon, it was relatively quiet. The palace was beautiful and kept in a very good condition. It was a good choice to spend an hour or so away from the sun.
Very old palace. Lots of rooms, gardens, nice to walk around and admire the details. Not that much to see though and packed with tourists.

Pretty but repetitive. There is no doubt that the Palace is beautiful, the tiles are gorgeous and the rooms beautiful. It would be much improved if there was more of an explanation of what each room was for and perhaps if a few were furnished with the sort of thing that would have originally been there. It was very busy but a pleasant way to pass an hour.

Fabulous display of Moroccan architecture. I've been to Bahia twice now and both times was entranced by the seemingly endless series of beautifully decorated rooms, lush green courtyards and other areas of the palace to explore. It seems incredibly good value for the equivalent of 1 euro - such a great place to visit. It was particularly good when we visited as the Marrakech biennial had the palace rooms full of all sorts of modern art which only enhanced the experience.

Crowded but worth a visit to enjoy stunning architectur. We visited before lunch time and it was quite crowded inside. However we enjoyed the nice atmosphere with little gardens and the rooms were you could just sit in the shade and imagine how life must have been there back in the days. The entry is also not expensive so it is definately worth a visit if you spend some more days in marrakesh.
Tho old (the palace) blended with the new(theexhibition). Lovely afternoon- a good time to visit a charming, very old palce and to view a fine exhibition of modern art

Worth the effort. We loved our visits here - went twice; once on our own and once with our tour group. The building has beautiful architecture and an interesting story with the harem quarters, etc. Only $1 or so to enter.

Don't go out of your way. . We went to see this palace because it was recommended as one of the main things to see in Marrakech. We weren't particularly impressed, as it's extremely repetitive and overran by tourists so you can't appreciate it properly anyway. If you wanna tick it off a list then go, else, spend more time in the souks.
Well worth a visit. An oasis of calm in a rather chaotic medina! Beautiful carving especially on the ceilings and well worth the small entry fee.
Beautiful Tilework. This Palace has lovely gardens and exquisite Tile and woodwork. We had a guided tour and learned much about the history of the residents.It is just outside the Medina.

a nice calm place in chaotic Marrakech. This Palace is very modest.. Beautiful tiles, amazing wood crafted ceilings. but don't expect jaw-dropping details. Definitely worth's the visit. only 10 Dirham to enter.

Beautiful. A beautiful palace, some rooms are a remarkable work of Moroccan art, especially the ceilings. I was pleasantly surprised to see many refurbishing work going on, some new rooms are open for visitors which wasn't the case before.Although it would have been great of the many empty rooms could be used for some art exhibitions such as photography and paintings.

Interesting to see a different way of life. We visited the Bahia Palace as part of a tour, which is probably the best way to visit. There is no information around so without a guide you would not know or appreciate what you are seeing. The palace is made up of the Main living quarters, the favourite wives quarters and the concubines quarters, there is also a garden. The decor is ornate and shows the wealth of the owner and is interesting to see and hear how they lived.

Unique palace in Marrakech. Indeed, this is a wonderful place to visit: the level of craftsmanship is outstanding: the mosaic, the woodwork, the planning that went into the palace...Two pieces of advise: go with a guide so that s/he can point out some details and tell you about the history of the place and the tradition that permeates it. Also, make it one of the first stops in your morning itinerary: it will be crowded if you go later in the morning.

Could you imagine living here ?. Beautiful example of 19th century architecture originally built for a Moroccan minister and advisor to the King. Unfortunately, no furniture still exists from that period but enjoy exploring the Minister's offices and the harem rooms once occupied by his 24 consorts.
Nice to see. . Great architecture and nice to see. Expected it to be bigger. Was very busy even when I went early. Worth a visit but will only fill an hour or so. Cheap entry.
What a tranquil place. Beautiful gardens, the decor is amazing, so big inside, just loved this, the surrounding area so busy but inside here just lovely.
Gorgeous tilework. Absolutely gorgeous in here, i am in love with Moroccan tiles and this place is full of them! The gardens are gorgeous. 100% worth a visit, you cannot miss this place!

Moroccan aesthetics. Very close to the El Badi Palace and the Jema El Fna is the beautiful Bahia Palace, arguably the most beautiful historic site of Marrakech. It is at a walking distance from both the above. Even when you visit it in peak summer, it gives you a cool, soothing feeling. No palace in Morocco is as grand as the ones in Europe but this one has a typical relaxed Moroccan style to it. Sadly, a large part is closed to public. The carvings on the walls and the roof are exquisite. Not very big. An hour is enough for a normal visitor but it's a must visit for those visiting Marrakech.
palace in the middle of Medina. Great palace in the middle of Medina. when wondering around Medina you will no doubt run into it.. Go, enter and see it ..

Beautiful place!. We visited the Bahia Palace in March and had a great time touring it. Beautiful landscaping and gorgeous interior details. Fun addition to the afternoon for a minimal cost. Would definitely visit again!
Nice architecture and paintings. It's worth a visit for its painted ceilings and walls, it's architecture and the garden. Look out for tortoises in the courtyard.

Nice. It was a nice visit with a tour group. True Moroccan style. The tile work, wood work were quite amazing. Even the ceilings were decorated with great workmanship. Just be careful as there are many hidden steps, knee breakers, and you want to be sure you don't twist a knee or break an angle.
Look up !. Always a lot of visitors. Beautiful buildings and innercourts. Admire the splendour of the painted roofings and the coloured walls of the harem, not to mention all the carved wood !

Jam packed with tourists. Hard to even hear your own guide as you wander from room to room here. Impossible to get a sense of place here but easy to see how popular Marrakech is as a travel destination.

A lovely visit - steeped in History. Most interesting visit to see how the 'well do to' lived many moons ago - beautifully kept with lovely garden areas and the intricate decor internally is exquisite - probably won't need more than an hour here but interesting and insight into Moroccan history :)
It was okay. Just an empty palace, tickets had to buy from the front gate but loads of people were walking in without one. No one even asked for our ticket,

Amazing place . Must go to this place, it's a really good day out and it's only 10DH to enter that's like not even a pound. We even saw a turtle waking around! The courtyard is huge and still in good condition.

Gorgeous palace . Bahia Palace's beauty is in the details. All throughout the palace the tile work, ceilings, and windows are intricate and beautiful. Room after room provides great example of Islamic Art.
The only downside is the guides are only in Arabic and French. More robust displays would help provide a greater understanding and context to the art and palace complex.
Well worth a visit. Went as part of a tour with our riad and didnt dissapoint. Its absolutely huge! So much beautiful mosaic work and huge grounds. A very peaceful afternoon

Palace . Not a great Palace but fair enough for one euro entrance. You should go there to take some ideas of a Palace in Marrakech! I liked being there, but it is not the most beautiful Palace you will see.
This is a MUST see if you're visiting Marrakech!. Beautiful tile and wood work and lush gardens make this a MUST see. Totally worth the nominal entrance fee.
